decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to control the game through various means such as countering spells, removing threats, and manipulating the opponent's hand and library. It utilizes powerful vintage cards like Force of Will, Ancestral Recall, and Time Walk to gain advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful artifact cards like Black Lotus and Sol Ring for additional acceleration. With the addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck aims to maintain a strong board presence and card advantage while limiting the opponent's resources.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing various artifacts and spells. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and slow down their game plan. The deck takes advantage of cards that generate mana, such as Moxen, to power out powerful spells and abilities. It also leverages the power of card draw and tutoring effects to find key pieces needed for control. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds another layer of versatility and resilience. Overall, the deck aims to establish board control and outmaneuver the opponent through careful resource management and efficient use of its tools.

The key concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana and card advantage in order to execute a powerful storm combo. The deck includes cards such as Vampiric Tutor, Ancestral Recall, and Demonic Tutor to search for key combo pieces. It also utilizes fast mana acceleration cards like Mox Sapphire and Black Lotus to quickly ramp up its resources. The storm combo is achieved through cards like Tendrils of Agony and Mind's Desire, which deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent based on the spells cast during the turn. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Flusterstorm and Force of Will to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies.

The key concept of this deck is to use the Doomsday card to quickly and efficiently assemble a winning combination of cards. The deck utilizes various tutors, such as Mystical Tutor and Vampiric Tutor, to search for key pieces. It also includes powerful spells like Black Lotus, Mox Jet, and Mox Sapphire to generate mana quickly. The deck aims to create a situation where it can cast Doomsday, rearrange the top five cards of the library to set up a winning sequence, and then use cards like Thassa's Oracle to win the game.

The deck's main focus is on controlling the game and utilizing the Oath of Druids card. The deck includes a mix of cards to enable the Oath of Druids ability, such as Forbidden Orchard and Show and Tell, and cards to disrupt the opponent's strategies, like Force of Will and Flusterstorm. It also includes powerful cards such as Ancestral Recall, Bolas's Citadel, and Oko, Thief of Crowns to gain an advantage. Additionally, the deck has some additional card draw and tutoring options with cards like Sensei's Divining Top, Brainstorm, and Demonic Tutor.

This deck is focused on quickly generating and manipulating mana to cast a high number of spells in a single turn, aiming to create a storm of powerful effects. It utilizes cards like Dark Ritual and Lórien Revealed to generate additional mana, while cards like Demonic Tutor and Mystical Tutor allow for precise searching of key combo pieces. The deck also includes powerful artifact cards like Sensei's Divining Top and Lotus Petal to further enhance its speed and consistency. Ultimately, the deck aims to build up a large storm count and cast a devastating spell like Tendrils of Agony to win the game.

This deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, aiming to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells. It utilizes the unique abilities of cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Squee, Goblin Nabob to quickly fill the graveyard and gain advantage. The deck also includes powerful graveyard recursion with Noxious Revival and Force of Vigor, allowing for consistent board presence. With a mix of counter spells and disruptive spells like Mindbreak Trap and Force of Negation, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a strong offense with creatures like Vengevine, Hollow One, and Master of Death.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly assemble and execute the Doomsday combo. The deck aims to use various card draw and manipulation spells, such as Ponder, Brainstorm, and Preordain, to set up the perfect stack of cards with Doomsday. It utilizes cards like Demonic Consultation and Demonic Tutor to search for the necessary combo pieces, and protection spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to ensure the combo resolves without disruption. Thassa's Oracle serves as the win condition, allowing the player to win the game after manipulating their deck with Doomsday.

The main concept of this deck is to rapidly fill the graveyard with dredge cards, such as Ichorid, Stinkweed Imp, Golgari Thug, and Shambling Shell. This enables powerful graveyard interactions, such as returning creatures like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam to the battlefield, either for free or at a reduced cost. The deck also utilizes cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to dig through the deck quickly and find key pieces. Additionally, Force of Will and Force of Negation provide protection and disruption while Silversmote Ghoul and Creeping Chill provide added life gain and damage.

The key concept of this deck is to rapidly swarm the board with aggressive and efficient goblins. The deck utilizes a combination of fast mana acceleration and powerful goblin synergy to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The inclusion of powerful goblin payoffs like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Muxus, Goblin Grandee further enhances the deck's explosiveness. By utilizing cards like Goblin Recruiter and Goblin Matron, the deck is able to consistently find and assemble its key pieces, setting up for devastating turns of goblin onslaught. The deck also includes specific lands like City of Traitors and Cavern of Souls to support its aggressive game plan.

The main concept of this Vintage 1 vs 1 deck is to utilize the Combo archetype and take advantage of the card Underworld Breach. The deck focuses on assembling powerful combination plays where cards like Tinker and Mystical Tutor are used to search for specific cards, while Underworld Breach allows for recurring spells from the graveyard. The deck also includes various powerful cards such as Ancestral Recall and Black Lotus to generate significant advantage. Overall, the deck aims to quickly and efficiently execute its combo strategy, overwhelming opponents with its explosive plays.
